intro: Centaurea pinardii, commonly known as the Pinard's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea pinardii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
